document_data.name: Shareen Ophal
document_data.mainbody:
'''Lady Shareen Ophal''' was an [[Amn]]ian noblewoman that lived in the city of [[Athkatla]] during the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|Excuse us, but we've decided to snub you.| Lady Shareen, alongside her husband Lord Dermod}}
document_data.Personality: Lady Shareen was extremely snobbish, acting dismissively to those she believed those that were lacking in social status.
document_data.Activities: She and her husband were regular patrons of [[Waukeen's Promenade]] in the [[Athkatla/Center District|Center District]] of Athkatla. They sat atop a large wooden platform surveying the wonders of the marketplace without resorting to speak to the lesser people that conducted business within.
document_data.Relationships: Lady Shareen was married to Lord [[Dermod Ophal]].
document_data.History: Both Lady and Lord Ophal were active in Waukeen's Promenade around the time a great magical battle between the [[Cowled Wizards]] and some unlicensed [[spellcaster]]s destroyed a section of the amphitheater, in the {{YearlinkName|1369}}.
